intro: Isachne albens var. elatiuscula, commonly known as the silvergrass or silverleaf grass, is a variant of the isachne albens species. It is a perennial grass characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves that often have a silvery or whitish hue on the underside. This plant typically grows in moist, temperate climates and is often found in wet meadows or along stream banks. Its inflorescence consists of a single spikelet that is usually erect and compact. The botanical features of this variant make it distinct from other members of the isachne genus, particularly in its leaf coloration and growth habit.
